newsitem.title: MADAGASCAR: Five more candidates cleared for Madagascar poll.
newsitem.headline: Five more candidates cleared for Madagascar poll.

text.p: A high court cleared five candidates on Thursday to stand in the November 3 presidential election on the Indian Ocean island of Madagascar, bringing the total to 15.
The high constitutional court said it approved applications from the five candidates including interim President Norbert Ratsirahonana and National Assembly President Richard Andrianmanjato.
Ten candidates approved on Tuesday included former president Albert Zafy, whose impeachment by parliament in July cleared the way for the election, and former president Didier Ratsiraka.
The court rejected applications to stand as candidates from a Malagasy now living in France, Max Fabien Andrianirina, and the leader of a workers' movement, Francois Randrianantoandro.
The deadline for registering ended on Friday and campaigning on the world's fourth largest island starts on October 13.
The race is expected to focus on five or six candidates.
Retired admiral Ratsiraka, 59, the father of Madagascar's 1975 socialist revolution, returned to his homeland for the race on September 29, ending 19 months of voluntary exile in France.
Zafy, 70, won Madagascar's multi-party elections in 1993 by defeating former military ruler Ratsiraka, ending his 17 years in power, after an unprecedented campaign of popular protest at his rule.
But Zafy's presidency was dogged by instability, culminating in his impeachment by parliament for violating the constitution.
